intro: Camissonia campestris subsp. obispoensis, commonly known as Obispo's camisson, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The subspecies is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland habitats. It blooms in spring and is often associated with open habitats such as coastal dunes and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
